availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James K. Thomson (Fayette County, KY, farmer & curator of Kentucky Univ)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer and curator. Virginia native. Married to Susan T. Thomson. Father of James C. Thomson. Married to Mildred A. Ford Thomson. Father of Frank Thomson. Farmer in Fayette County in 1850. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Employed William C. Stone as a farmer in 1850. Farmer in Fayette County in 1860. Owned fifteen enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1860. Member of the board of curators of Kentucky University in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 234B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 715 (p. 32 of microfilm).

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 406A (p. 11 of microfilm).
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 37A.
